Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: HermanaLinda
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Loma Lodge. It was quite, clean and tastefully furnished. The rates were reasonable. My only complaint was not enough outlets to charge our laptop and cell phones. Free wifi but the connection was a bit faint. All in all, a good night.

Reviews.Title: “Keith”
Reviews.Author: Dani's P
Reviews.Content: I came in very late one night and had a reservation through Hotwire and apparently Hotwire did not give payment information to the hotel and they said I owed for the night. I had prepaid through Hotwire, but Keith, the clerk got on the phone with Hotwire and while he was on hold he figured out what happened and was kind enough to bring me out from the cold while I waited and took my bag to the room. This isn't a four star hotel, but I had four star service.

Reviews.Title: “Review of recent trip”
Reviews.Author: Crystal G
Reviews.Content: I recently went to San Diego where I was once a resident of 12 years to visit my 4 children and as usual I chose the Loma Lodge. The staff was friendly and professional, the breakfast bar was a great way to start the day and meet other travelers and when I had problems with my visa card the staff went out of their way to accomodate and help me. I plan on coming back in July to enjoy their beautiful pool!

Reviews.Title: “It is the Best deal in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Craigk61
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay. The staff is great, they all know the City well .I stay at loma lodge it is close to everything. Golf, Restaurants of all type ,all major highways,Old Town,Down Town ,It is always very Clean It is the BEST DEAL FOR THE PRICE IN SAN DIEGO.!!!!!! Stay and see.

Reviews.Title: “Saved by Loma Lodge's excellent cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: Anthony D
Reviews.Content: I live "Downunder" in Western Australia. I was visiting friends I made in the early 1990's when I played in Dixieland Jazz Bands. My visit included the 2011 Thanksgiving Day San Diego Jazz Festival. Kind friends let me use their home in Point Loma during the Festival, however, unexpectedly, this caused me to come down with severe allergic sinus infections, so much so, that I missed my flight home! Happily, Loma Lodge provided the fresh clean air in a super comfortable room with excellent bathroom facilities to allow two day's recovery prior to the delayed 41 hour trip home! What a blessed relief! The shopping on the other side of Rosecrans Street also provided lovely gifts for family & grandchildren! So disaster turned into a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kim R
Reviews.Content: I am completely satisfied with my stay. The staff was caring and extremely helpful with any needs we had.

Reviews.Title: “Very Well Maintained and Cozy !”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at this motel .. We really enjoyed the staff and the hospitality.. We were here in August (2011) and plan on returning in October (2011) .Great Location :-) 100% Recomendation !

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait until next Summer at Loma Lodge !!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin D
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this motel. It felt very home like. They had a fantastic weekly rate which really came in handy when on a family vacation. I was surprised to see they had a pool and it was open until 10:PM !! Absolutely Fantastic. I was happier to find out that this is a family run motel and has been owned by the same family since opening about 50 years ago!! I don't know why these other reviews weren't updated since the last. Must be under new management because this place is GREAT! All the staff was very friendly and it was nice to see such a sharp young man assisting guests at the front desk who really knew his city. See ya next summer Loma Lodge and Thank You for a wonderful week

Reviews.Title: “As usual we had a great visit”
Reviews.Author: blpettyaz
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Loma Lodge and recommend it to friends for a reasonable place to stay. We have never had a problem here like some of the ones mentioned in other reviews. Yes, this hotel is an older building and it is small, that is part of the charm for us. It is close to everywhere in San Diego that we like to visit and we appreciate the price. We hope to be back for another visit soon, we have probably stayed there at least 6 or 7 times now.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad and we didn't have a bug problem like the last review”
Reviews.Author: kcwood
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for a wedding the weekend of Comic Con 2011! Since we live in Los Angeles (2 hours away) we didn't want to pay a lot just to sleep so I picked this hotel. The receptionist was really pleasant upon check in and the next morning. Our room (#33) was facing the street but with the air condidtioner on and the TV (HBO included) we didn't hear much traffic noise. My only suggestion would be to have the rugs cleaned as I had to wear socks when walking on the rug in the room since the rug was very very sticky. Location was perfect for us since the wedding was at the University of San Diego and the reception was at The Abbey. BTW: the pool looked very inviting :o)

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO TO THIS MOTEL...BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: DesertLady_11
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a cute, inexpensive location. Very quiet and better quality than a Motel 6. With the air and TV on I heard no outside noise at all. When I checked in I killed a tiny bug on the sheet. Didn't think much about it. I thought bed bugs were microscopic. The next morning I found two large bugs and killed them with my book. I called the mgr. to come and look at them. He was very apologetic and instantly said they would refund my money which they did. He did tell me that this has been an ongoing problem. In the morning as I packed, I noticed the floor did not look as though it had been vacuumed. There was a business card on the floor (not one of mine), that should have been found if vacuumed. I really wanted to like this motel. The woman at check in was very friendly and professional. Good location, reasonable price. I have a call in to the city's vector (bug) division. I hope they get this problem solved because w/o the bed bugs and a thorough cleaning it would be a reasonable place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “So-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: DNT16
Reviews.Content: We thought we got a good deal on the room until we saw the room. First think we noticed was the smell. Its an older hotel and it smells that way. Then the next morning we saw a big and ugly stein on the sheets. So people check the bed completely before going to bed. The area was nice. Couple of stores close by, like Walgreens. Close to major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “GO ELSEWHERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: illyanna
Reviews.Content: Crack pipe wrapped in tissue was found. Woke up with bed bug bites. Will not give a detailed receipt. Bathroom smelled of mildew. Ice machine is a quarter and you get flecks of black mold in it. Fridge has water pooled on the bottom. Sink leaks. Not worth it at all. Prices are different from advertised!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would do it all over again!”
Reviews.Author: DannyRay
Reviews.Content: Hotel and rooms are in excellent condition and very clean. Rooms are plenty spacious enough for two people, nicely decorated, good size bathroom, bed was very comfortable, small refrigerator, microwave, and again very very clean. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating. They had coffee on with danish's and muffin's every morning in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes up for a lot.”
Reviews.Author: slowasmolasses
Reviews.Content: Point Loma, although one of the most beautiful spots on the west coast suffers from noise. No matter where you stay you are affected by air traffic, buses, trucks and ships. In today's language "Get over it" seems the appropriate phrase. At that point this hacienda offers a lot and as a review of the map points out it really is close to everything. The other reviews speak well of it and I agree. I was treated very well by the staff. I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Convenient, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Davemack98
Reviews.Content: For the second year I stayed at LOMA LODGE on Rosecrans St in San Diego. The staff was very nice, The room had a huge bed, combination refridgerator and microwave, TV and of course parking for my rental. While unadvertised I was able to get a great weekly rate whice ended ub being less than I was quoted when I booked the room 2 months prior. The offer wireless internet, limited Directv and continental breakfast. Anyone visiting San Diego for business or in my case to take a vacation from winter would do well to stay there. Rest assured the next time I visit San Diego I will again stay at Loma Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: marshal2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loma Lodge for 2 nights over the Christmas weekend. My room and the rest of the hotel was clean and quiet. And this is in a great location near the freeways, and close to the Marine base as well. Overall, a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Clean cell style room”
Reviews.Author: Hayleyandmarvin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this motel with 3 friends. It was our only option as we unfortunatly planned our trip to San Diego at the same time as Comic Con. The motel was clean, and the staff were friendly. Very nice danishes for breakfast with free coffee. The spanish feel of the motel is very cute and welcoming, but our room was facing the busy main road with a small window that was high up, and therefore made our room feel like a prison cell. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in the local area, however it is a good 15 minute walk to the Old Town tram station to get into the city, therefore people with small children or disabled visitors may find this inconvenient. If you can find somewhere to stay in the Old Town, it is a lot better location.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: AslansKirk
Reviews.Content: Not a bad price for a place to stay in San Diego. It was within a couple miles of Sea World and a short drive of the USS Midway and harbor. Rooms and public areas were clean, but it's a pretty old property, and while it's been painted and has newer carpet, the rooms are still older. It was the little things that somewhat put us off. Paying 25 cents for ice from the ice machine (come on!). And the lobby was locked up well before sundown, so you had to ring a bell to get someone to let you check in. Neighborhood didn't seem that bad/

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean economic motel”
Reviews.Author: bobbwacs
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Loma ABV Lodge at a rate in low $60's for one of their updated rooms upstairs. Furnishings were adequate and room was clean and comfortable. Good selection especially if you are travelling on a budget. Although it is located a few blocks from some questionable adult businesses, I never saw any problems at all associated with this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Jeff12345_10
Reviews.Content: I had a very good stay at the Loma Lodge. I travel for business extensively and spend 3 or 4 nights a month in a hotel room at company per diem expense, but in this case I was staying near my home while it was being termite tented. I looked for value and found it at Loma Lodge. It was a quiet comfortable stay that included all the room amenities I look for; refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave, comfortable king size bed. Staff was friendly, location was walking distance to a Starbucks, restaurants, and a grocery store. I've passed the Loma Lodge business card around the office suggesting it for out of town guests that want to stay in San Diego within a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The old Bait & Switch”
Reviews.Author: mingorara
Reviews.Content: I have driven by this hotel many times. The rates advertised on the sign outside always seemed fair, so now that I needed a place to stay, I thought I'd give it a try. Both the daily and weekly prices on the electronic sign were significantly higher once I went in and tried to get a room. I stayed one night at the higher rate. Hours after I checked in, the sign outside was still offering the lower price. The hotel is nice enough, but I won't be going back because of the false advertising. Don't like being fooled.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: yardboz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the America's Best Value Inn Loma Lodge while visiting my daughter who is stationed at MCRD. Parking lot is a little tight, but I was able to get a spot every night with no trouble. Rooms were very clean, bed was comfortable. I thought the niose from planes flying overhead would be problematic, but inside the room it wasn't bad at all. Put the A/C on fan only and it pretty much covered up the plane noise. As others have said, the rooms are small, but I'm not sure whay that matters. I was only in my room to shower and sleep anyway. Location is quite good, being about 3 minutes to MCRD (if you have someone graduating I would definately stay here), mayeb 3 minutes to Old Town, and 5-7 minutes to Mission Beach. All of these locations can be reached without needing to get on the freeway. The only issue I had was with the WiFi. On the second floor the signal was pretty spotty. I always managed to get connected, but sometimes it took a while. May have been just my particular room. I tried using my laptop down by the pool, but that didn't work either. There are much nicer motels closer to the beach, (at better than twice the price) but you can't beat Loma Lodge for the price!

Reviews.Title: “What a great cozy place to stay close to all the atractions.”
Reviews.Author: rgh72
Reviews.Content: What a nice suprise, for the money you can't go wrong with this hotel , rooms were cozy with a nice king bed , also equiped with fridge and microwave , bathroom was very clean , staff was fery friendly. Great location to everything San Deigo has to offer , hope to get back there soon !

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestGypsy
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap hotel and you will get what you pay for. The manager is rude, arrogant and unwilling provide quality service. I would never recommend this hotel unless you do not care about service and only care about having a cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great room at a great rate!”
Reviews.Author: otnesa
Reviews.Content: While getting settled in San Diego, the Loma Lodge provided a perfect place to stay while waiting for my permanent place to be ready. The staff, especially Brian Johannsen, were very helpful and professional. The room exceeded my expectations and the price was surprisingly economical. I would't pass up the opportunity to stay here, if I were you. A great room at a great rate! - Ron Asento

Reviews.Title: “Agree with C.O.M.S.”
Reviews.Author: nasfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week as the guests of a kind neighbor family and loved the location, but I was told that the manager had problems with the way I supervised my children and would not allow us to stay another week--if we'd chosen to do so. Given that this was our vacation, the fact that I let my young son watch cartoons in the morning while I checked email for 15 minutes and his running into the parking lot while I was moving our laundry from washer to dryer is a ridiculous definition of "improper supervision." Manager attitude definitely has an impact on whether I would choose to stay in a place.

Reviews.Title: “Running Club: Best value for Rock N' Roll Marathon weekend!”
Reviews.Author: salincal
Reviews.Content: We are a running club in Los Angeles and since 2003, about 50 to 70 members (each year) from our club have been staying at Loma Lodge for the Rock N' Roll San Diego Marathon. We LOVE the Loma Lodge and feel that we are always treated in a special way - we even get a "Welcome LA Running Club" on the signpost! This place is clean, economical, central and the staff rocks!! The manager is wonderful and works with our club's requests every year to accomodate the marathoners. Many members stay an extra night and just relax by the pool area to recover from the marathon. Some members bring their families and utilize the large family rooms on the bottom floor. Several members have indicated that Loma Lodge is their "go to" lodging when in the San Diego area for other events or a weekend getaway. Thanks Loma Lodge - we really appreciate your great value and service!!

Reviews.Title: “Correction to previous review!”
Reviews.Author: PagoPago5
Reviews.Content: Hi, I feel I was too harsh when I posted a review concerning the Loma Lodge. While I didn't like that the manager wouldn't change the credit card to my own account--he said it had already gone through and that he couldn't issue a refund and recharge it. That disturbed me, but other than this, the room was pretty clean and so was the pool area. However, we waited until ten o'clock in the morning to swim and after we got in the pool five minutes a pool cleaner showed up and told us we had to get out. We asked him if he would give us at least ten minutes for the kids to swim. He did, but this was rather disturbing also as we had to check out by 11:30 a.m. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet little place for family at a good price”
Reviews.Author: PettyLynne
Reviews.Content: We went back to the Loma Lodge for a 2nd stay, and intend to return. This place is small, friendly, and a great location for our family. A little bit of a drive to the beach, but very close to everything you want to visit in San Diego. Better than Hotel Circle. We thought the price couldn't be beat. It is not fancy but a good clean place to stay. The staff was very nice, even let us check-in to our room earlier in the day than normal. Nothing is brand new here but everything was clean and well kept. The pool area was small but nice and clean with seating, etc. The room we had was considered a "family room" which consisted of a normal room with 2 beds, a sliding glass door to the pool area and another room with an additional bed, a table with 2 chairs, a small refrigerator and a small microwave. The bathroom was small but funtional for us. There was no fee for parking in their lot, we had a space right outside our door. Being a family of 4, it worked out great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the money, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: drccds
Reviews.Content: We looked it up on here and were quoted $79/night. We called and were quoted $59/night. We showed up there without a reservation and there is a big sign saying it is $49.99/night. It is an older place. The air unit had 6 settings, 3 of which worked and the temperature dial did not work at all. The room was OK, but no more than that. We were in the back so it was reasonably quiet altho we heard planes going over in the morning. Check out time was 11AM, and the pool doesn't open until 10AM, so that is hard to use. I was able to use the internet in the lobby and print my boarding passes, so that worked out well. Continental breakfast was OK, but just coffee/juice and muffins/rolls. It isn't expensive and is reasonable for the money, but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Cantakerous Old Man Syndrome”
Reviews.Author: meinheimer
Reviews.Content: This place has decent rooms for the price. You cannot cook anything whatsoever though, you must use the worst microwave in the world. The center carousel does not, and it is very underpowered. You must also take maid service every four days, but in actuality, it turns out to be once a week if you stay more than a week. Then when you try and talk to them about it they brush you off. They will not even let you get clean sheets until the designated time. So if you want sheets early forget it. I tried asking the staff to please try and clean my room a little early, I was rudely informed that she would get there when she got there, and that that was part of the service, every four days they do a thorough cleaning of the room, I then proceded to inform him that his staff did not clean thoroughly at all the last week, then he said I looked at the chart and it says she did, so she must have. Alright, I love paying someone to treat me like garbage and call me a liar, not for me thank you. I am checking out Tuesday and hopefully will never have to deal with these people again. I guess they care more about their employees than their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: muddypond
Reviews.Content: We have just checked out from a weeks' stay at Loma Lodge--absolutely wonderful stay!! This past week has been so enjoyable-- fantastic employees- the staff is so friendly and personable. Wonderful location- close to everything. Impeccably CLEAN!! Very affordable rates- especially the weekly rate. We have already booked our next stay for Spring of 2009-- can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freshlyd
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year in a row we have stayed at the Loma Lodge. It is not fancy and it is a little out of the way but it is nice and the location is very central to most of San Diego's attractions. They have free Wi-fi access which was nice and no one really bothers us while we are there. I recommend this place to low to low maintenance travellers only.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service and discount price rooms that are very clean and comforta”
Reviews.Author: Korina1
Reviews.Content: I was very saticefied with the service that I recieved there. My stay was relaxing and made to feel very comfortable. The prices are very affordable. You can not beet this motel/ hotel even if you try.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the LOma Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Retired-golfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loma Lodge for a week and enjoyed our stay. We had a room at the back - behind the lobby. The room was small but worked well. The shower was actually very good - the water stayed the same temp for the entire shower. It is an economy hotel but is clean and works. The only issue would be noise with noisy neighbors or a room next to the boulevard out front. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable”
Reviews.Author: gesell
Reviews.Content: Loma Lodge was a basic acceptable hotel. We arrived on the weekend and found out that it is dificult to get rooms in that area. It is about a15 minute walk to the old town. The price of the room doubles on the weekends but Mon to Thurs it has cheaper rates. The halls, corridors and pool were quaint. The room was basic and has had some renos done. It is just off a busy street with some noise. The staff seem friendly, but the manager seemed upset when my 14 year old son want to go on the computer to check emails. When I arrived it was suddenly ok. The breakfest is basic continental with donuts and danish. hated the coffee though, at least Starbucks was close by.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to hell!”
Reviews.Author: gza222
Reviews.Content: Dont do it! We booked over the phone from Vegas and got quoted a price of around US$90 per night in a standard double room and trusted the lady at the front desk regarding how good the value was. When we arrived we noticed a large sign board stating the price was US$45 per night! When i asked them to refund the difference they said they wouldnt and nor could they provide a refund. The sign was also removed very quickly. Anyway, we realised we had to settle for this motel since they were not going to refund us at all. We were then put in a room on the street. Extremely noisy, but we dealt with it. The next morning our toilet was severly blocked and we couldnt use it. Asked reception for help which took a good 45 mins. Asked to change rooms to move away from the street. They said they were full. Then I asked to see the manager and all of a sudden, a room was now available off the street! Rooms - small, dark and musty. Very noisy if facing the road. They were however, reasonably clean. Service - the brochure promises 'San Dieogos' friendliest service. Wrong! Unhelpful, and generally lazy. Location - Point Loma is a good location, however, being on one of San Diego's main roads is not! Stay away. You'll definitely be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “positives & negatives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Loma Lodge over July 4th weekend for 4 nites. Overall the place was nice and the staff was OK -- nothing really wowed me. Some things underwhelmed me. We booked a king suite (I don't honestly remember the exact terminology of how they call the room). It was a king sized bed in the main room and then a doorway into a converted triangular closet that had a single bed, another TV and 2 chairs and a small table inside. The room was just OK from a cleanliness standpoint. My socks got REALLY dirty from walking on the carpeted floor, and the shower had some cracked tiles and mildew inside. The bathroom appeared mostly clean on the surface but if you looked you could see that it needed some superior sanitizing. The shower itself was full-sized, but had the worst water pressure and temp control. I had to run the cold water in the sink while showering to get hot water to come out of the shower head. The TV rec'd about 10 local/basic cable channels (and Carton Network w/out sound -- odd). There was a mini-fridge in the room but it was unplugged (which I didn't realize until I found my leftovers rotting the next day). The amenities were scare (no iron, no coffee maker, no hair dryer) and the AC took about 4 hours before the room started to cool down. Granted, it was an unseasonably hot (95 degrees one day & very humid) and most of the locals were complaining about the temps, however we engaged in a battle with the cleaning staff to leave the AC on in our room Each evening when we returned the AC was off and the room had heated back up to unbearable temperatures. Therefore, we ending up sharing the king sized bed underneath the AC unit and used the closet of a second room solely as a dressing area (the closet room had no AC). The walls very very thin. I don't think there was anyone in the room next to us, but we could hear people across the hall and anyone walking thru the hallway as if they were in our room (probably due to the 1Â½ gap underneath the door. Each evening there were flyers just inside the door for a local pizza/wings joint, but there was a cryptic security warning on cut up pieces of scrap paper from the front desk advising not to order from flyers stuffed under the door (with no explanation as to why). We hauled our bags up to the second floor which wasn't too bad for two middle-aged guys, but would not have been possible if I had my wheelchair bound grandmother with me. On the positive side, the desk staff was friendly and the housekeeping staff was very polite and responsive (if not aggressive). The Loma Lodge is located in a residential/light commercial district with plenty of amenities(drug store, supermarket, fast food & gas) nearby. Parking was cramped, but free. We parked 2 times on the street in the cute residential neighborhood behind the lodge w/out incident. A bus line runs in front of the lodge and taxis are supposedly available as well. (The front desk called us a taxi twice on Friday nite and we waited for over an hour and it never arrived, although I can't hold the front desk responsible for that). The pool area looked nice and clean, but we did not use it. The lodge is close to Sea World by car, as well as the I-5 and the PCH, so it's easy to get around by car. The Loma Lodge has some quaint attributes that harken back to the days of the mid-century motor lodge and boasts a great vintage sign out front. The facade, tilework and public areas are nice, but not indicative of the interior of the room we rented. We paid $109 for 3 nites and $129 for one nite.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: NationalGeographic1
Reviews.Content: Great service, great price and clean rooms. It was nice staying somewhere that you could tell that the ones working there really cared. Loma Lodge is not fancy, but if you want a place to stay that feels safe, clean and homey, this is it!!

HotelInfo.Name: Americas Best Value Inn Loma Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 3202 Rosecrans Street, San Diego, CA 92110 (Formerly Loma Lodge)
